### Copilot / AI agent instructions for credo-controller

Goal: help an AI coding agent become productive quickly in this TypeScript Express + TSOA REST API that wraps Credo/AFJ functionality.

Keep guidance short, searchable, and actionable (20-50 lines). Focus only on patterns discoverable from the codebase.

- Entry points
  - Main server setup: `src/server.ts` (calls `setupServer`) and `src/index.ts` (exports `startServer`). The CLI binary is `bin/afj-rest.js` which calls into the compiled `build` artifacts.
  - Routes are autogenerated by TSOA and live in `src/routes/routes.ts` (regenerate with `yarn run tsoa` / `yarn run compile`).

- Build & dev commands (from `package.json`)
  - Dev (fast): `yarn dev` (runs `tsoa spec-and-routes && tsnd --respawn samples/sampleWithApp.ts`).
  - Full build: `yarn build` (cleans, compiles, generates routes/spec, patches swagger). Use this before publishing or running `node ./bin/afj-rest.js`.
  - Regenerate routes/spec: `yarn run tsoa` or `yarn run compile` (both call `tsoa spec-and-routes`). After regenerating run `node ./scripts/patch-swagger.js` to apply local fixes.
  - Tests: `yarn test` (Jest). Static types: `yarn run check-types`.

- Where to start reading
  - `src/setupServer` logic: `src/server.ts` shows OpenTelemetry init, middleware stack, rate-limiter, `/docs` swagger serving, and error handling.
  - `src/authentication.ts` shows `expressAuthentication` used by TSOA for `apiKey` and `jwt` strategies and multi-tenancy behavior (dynamic API key, JWT secret cached in agent generic records).
  - `src/utils/tsyringeTsoaIocContainer.ts` shows controllers are constructed from `tsyringe` container — dependency injection used widely.
  - `src/cliAgent.ts` and `bin/afj-rest.js` (compiled in `build/bin`) show agent construction options and sample CLI flags (useful when changing startup behavior).
  - `src/routes/*` is generated; never edit manually. Controllers live under `src/controllers/*` — prefer edits there.

- Key project conventions & gotchas
  - TSOA generated files in `src/routes` are considered canonical for the OpenAPI schema. Regenerate with `yarn run tsoa` and commit the changes.
  - Controllers use dependency injection via `tsyringe`. To wire a new dependency register it in the DI container or `container.registerInstance` where appropriate (see `src/server.ts`).
  - Authentication: `expressAuthentication` expects either `Authorization: <dynamicApiKey>` (apiKey) or `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` (jwt). Dynamic API key is set at server start via `setDynamicApiKey` and stored in `config.json` at startup.
  - Multi-tenancy: presence of `tenants` module in `agent.modules` toggles multi-tenant behavior. JWT `role` claims determine whether a token is for tenant or base agent. Be careful when adding routes: use appropriate TSOA security decorators (see `src/routes/routes.ts` auth mappings such as `{"jwt":["tenant"]}`).
  - Swagger patching: `scripts/patch-swagger.js` applies project-specific fixes after `tsoa` generates the spec—run it after regenerating routes.
  - Patches: the repo uses `patch-package` and `patches/` to apply fixes to node_modules; `postinstall` runs `patch-package` automatically.

- Tests & verification
  - Run `yarn test` for unit tests. For quick smoke: `yarn dev` to start a dev server and browse `http://localhost:3000/docs`.
  - Type checks: `yarn run check-types` (uses `tsc --noEmit -p tsconfig.build.json`).

- Integration points & external deps
  - This package wraps AFJ (Aries Framework JS) / Credo modules: look at dependencies `@credo-ts/*` and `@hyperledger/*` in `package.json`.
  - Webhooks & WebSocket: `setupServer` wires event listeners (e.g., `credentialEvents`, `proofEvents`) if `socketServer` or `webhookUrl` is provided.
  - OpenTelemetry is initialized in `src/tracer.ts` and started in `setupServer`.

- Small code examples for common tasks
  - Regenerate routes and apply swagger patch:

    1. yarn run tsoa
    2. node ./scripts/patch-swagger.js
    3. yarn build

  - Create a controller that needs a DI service:

    - Register service with `container.register` or `container.registerInstance` in `src/server.ts` (or where the agent is created).
    - Add a controller under `src/controllers/*Controller.ts` and decorate with TSOA decorators. Run `yarn run tsoa` to regenerate `src/routes`.

- Files to inspect when debugging
  - `src/server.ts` (middleware, error handling)
  - `src/authentication.ts` (security logic)
  - `src/routes/routes.ts` (how TSOA wired routes & security)
  - `scripts/patch-swagger.js` (post-processing for OpenAPI)
  - `src/utils` (DI container, server config, logger, request context)

If anything in this file is unclear or you'd like more examples (tests, DI registration, common PR patterns), tell me which area to expand and I will iterate.
